infos.name: kitchen
infos.desc:
Well how about that, you are in the place we're calling the kitchen.

 You make out a fridge. Now why would someone leave that there?[if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The fridge contains [a list of things in the c_0]. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best?[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] You can see an oven.[if oven_0 is open and there is something in the oven_0] The oven contains [a list of things in the oven_0].[end if][if oven_0 is open and the oven_0 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] You smell an intriguing smell, and follow it to a table. [if there is something on the s_0]On the table you make out [a list of things on the s_0].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0]However, the table, like an empty table, has nothing on it. It would have been so cool if there was stuff on the table.[end if] You make out a counter. You shudder, but continue examining the counter. [if there is something on the s_1]On the counter you make out [a list of things on the s_1].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1]But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of junk. You make a mental note to not get your hopes up the next time you see a counter in a room.[end if] Look out! It's a- oh, never mind, it's just a stove. The stove is conventional.[if there is something on the stove_0] On the stove you see [a list of things on the stove_0].[end if][if there is nothing on the stove_0] But the thing is empty. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?[end if]

infos.name: fridge
infos.desc: The [noun] looks stuffy. [if open]It is open.[else if locked]It is locked.[otherwise]It is closed.[end if]

---------

Ingredients:
red onion

Directions:

  prepare meal
